form.restingHRInfo: To measure your resting heart rate, count your pulse for 60 seconds upon waking in the morning before getting out of bed.

info.title: About Heart Rate
info.description: Maximum heart rate is the highest number of times your heart can beat per minute during maximum physical exertion. It's generally calculated using the formula 220 - age. Training zones help you optimize your workouts based on your goals.
info.formula: Formula: Max HR = 220 - age | Target HR = ((Max HR - Resting HR) Ã— % Intensity) + Resting HR
info.warmupDesc: Ideal for warming up and cooling down. Improves overall health and aids in recovery.
info.fatburnDesc: Optimal zone for burning fat. At this intensity, your body uses fat as the primary energy source.
info.cardioDesc: Improves cardiovascular capacity and endurance. Ideal for improving aerobic performance.
info.peakDesc: High-intensity training. Develops speed and power. Only for short sessions.
info.limitations: The 220 - age formula is a general estimate. Actual maximum heart rate can vary based on individual factors such as genetics, fitness level, and medications. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting an intense exercise program.
